intro: Dalechampia linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered yellowish flowers. It is often found in wetland areas and is adapted to moist, sandy soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
